subprocess_flow.description: The Development Team prepares the demonstration environment, ensuring that all necessary software, hardware, and data are properly configured and accessible. This includes setting up any required test environments or staging areas.
success_criteria: The demonstration environment is fully configured and ready for use.

subprocess_flow.description: The Development Team selects the most relevant and impactful features to demonstrate, aligning with the Sprint Goal and showcasing the value delivered. They rehearse the demonstration to ensure a smooth and engaging presentation.
success_criteria: The team is prepared to demonstrate the key features completed during the sprint.

subprocess_flow.description: The Product Owner invites key stakeholders to the Sprint Review, ensuring that all relevant parties are informed and available to attend. This includes sending out meeting invitations and providing any necessary context or pre-reading materials.
success_criteria: Key stakeholders are invited and confirm their attendance.

subprocess_flow.description: The Product Owner restates the Sprint Goal at the beginning of the Sprint Review, reminding everyone of the objectives for the sprint. This sets the context for the demonstration and helps stakeholders understand the value delivered.
success_criteria: The Sprint Goal is clearly restated and understood by all attendees.

subprocess_flow.description: The Development Team demonstrates the completed work, showcasing the new features and functionality that were delivered during the sprint. The demonstration should be interactive and engaging, allowing stakeholders to ask questions and provide feedback.
success_criteria: All key features completed during the sprint are demonstrated effectively.

subprocess_flow.description: The Product Owner actively solicits feedback from stakeholders on the demonstrated features, capturing their thoughts, suggestions, and concerns. This feedback is crucial for informing future sprints and ensuring that the product aligns with stakeholder expectations.
success_criteria: Stakeholders provide valuable and actionable feedback on the demonstrated features.

subprocess_flow.description: The Product Owner updates the Product Backlog based on the feedback received from stakeholders, adding new user stories, modifying existing ones, or reprioritizing items as necessary. This ensures that the backlog reflects the latest stakeholder input and business priorities.
success_criteria: The Product Backlog is updated to reflect stakeholder feedback and current business priorities.

subprocess_flow.description: The Product Owner summarizes the key outcomes of the Sprint Review, including the feedback received, the changes made to the Product Backlog, and any action items identified. This ensures that everyone is aligned on the next steps and that the Sprint Review has a clear conclusion.
success_criteria: The key outcomes of the Sprint Review are summarized and communicated to all attendees.
